name: confoundingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that confuses and surprises people, so that they are unable to explain or deal with a situation: The ending of the film is confoundingly vague. Somewhat confoundingly, he gave up his medical career to become a circus performer.
More examplesFewer examplesI found the characters in the play fascinating but confoundingly difficult to understand.As a songwriter she is famous for her confoundingly cryptic lyrics.Although they have a seemingly simple shape, snowflakes are actually confoundingly complex.
